description:
Their self-titled debut album was released at the 2019 Mahindra Blues
Festival, where they shared the stage with legends like Charlie Musselwhite,
Beth Hart, and Sugaray Rayford. They returned to the festival in 2023, opening
the show and jamming with icons such as Christone "Kingfish" Ingram, Taj
Mahal, and Buddy Guy. With growing acclaim from audiences and artists alike,
the Arinjoy Trio has become one of India's most sought-after blues bands.
name: Arinjoy Trio

performer.description: Formed in 2015, The Arinjoy Trio is one of the most exciting blues acts to emerge from the Indian music scene. Led by acclaimed guitarist and vocalist Arinjoy Sarkar, the trio also features Sounak Roy on drums and Aakash Ganguly on bass. Known for their high-energy live performances, the trio brings together a wide range of blues styles—from Chicago blues and blues rock to R&B—delivered with authenticity and passion.
performer.name: Arinjoy Trio

description:
Leading a powerhouse Moroccan pop quartet, LALA blends keys, percussion, and
traditional instruments into a sound both timeless and boundary-breaking. Her
rhythmic intuition--honed through heritage and heart--transforms concerts into
communal celebrations where strangers dance and mountains echo back in reply.
name: Lala Tamar

performer.description: LALA TAMAR is an electrifying force on the global stage—a vocalist, dancer, and gimbrist whose performances bridge cultures and generations. With roots in Morocco and Brazil, she channels deep North African grooves and feminine power into a bold, contemporary sound. Her music is a rich fusion of ancient traditions and modern pop, steeped in gnawa trance, the rhythms of the Atlas Mountains, and her grandmother’s songs, reborn through electric bass, qarqaba, and synth.
performer.name: Lala Tamar
